adjectives.description: miffed (comparative more miffed, superlative most miffed)

entries.meaning: (informal) Somewhat indignant, irritated, angry, put out or annoyed. In some regions of Britain it also means ‘confused’ or ‘not able to understand’.
examples: And also, it's generally not a good idea to prank someone who's already miffed at you.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of miff
